channel.title: The Economic Times
channel.description: The Economic Times: Latest business, finance, markets, stocks, company news from India.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C)Sat 30 Jan 2016, 16:47:572016Sat 30 Jan 2016, 16:47:57 Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://info.indiatimes.com/terms/tou.html

item.title: ET GBS: Budget will not be populist: FM Jaitley | Live
item.description: ET GBS: Budget will not be populist: FM Jaitley | LiveJaitley reiterated that the government was against retrospective taxes, saying these had brought little by way of revenue but given the country a bad name.

item.title: ET GBS: Defence sector like a Doberman - Parrikar | Make in India a mission: Prabhu
item.description: ET GBS: Defence sector like a Doberman - Parrikar | Make in India a mission: PrabhuIn defence exports, we have almost removed all restrictions and in 2016 there will be even easier ways of exporting even higher level material,” Parrikar said.

item.title: Gujarat CM Anandiben Patel gets a warning from BJP to resolve Patel agitation or quit
item.description: Gujarat CM Anandiben Patel gets a warning from BJP to resolve Patel agitation or quitThe party has given CM the message that the Patel community’s agitation for reservations has dragged on for too long and needs to be quelled now.

item.title: AAP MLA Mahinder Yadav gets bail in rioting case
item.description: AAP MLA Mahinder Yadav gets bail in rioting caseThe court had yesterday granted bail to four other accused - Rupesh Katyani, Devender Kumar, Roshan Kumar and Shailesh Kumar - who were also arrested in the case.

item.title: Padsalgikar to be next Mumbai Police Commissioner
item.description: Padsalgikar to be next Mumbai Police CommissionerPadsalgikar will take over tomorrow and succeeds Ahmed Javed, who has been appointed as Ambassador to Saudi Arabia.

item.title: Arunachal crisis: Shatrughan slams PM's 'advisors'
item.description: Arunachal crisis: Shatrughan slams PM's 'advisors' Shatrughan Sinha questioned the government's 'hurry and worry' when the matter was being heard by the apex court.

item.title: Rahul visits HCU: 'Classic politics of vulturisation'
item.description: Rahul visits HCU: 'Classic politics of vulturisation'BJP slammed Rahul Gandhi's visit to the HCU, charging the Congress with politicising the issue and dubbing the visit as "classic politics of vulturisation".

item.title: Bengaluru blast: Israeli delegation was a target
item.description: Bengaluru blast: Israeli delegation was a targetNIA has claimed that the crude bomb that went off on Church Street on December 28, 2014, was intended for an Israeli delegation.

item.title: BJP states win 10 out of 18 e-Governance awards
item.description: BJP states win 10 out of 18 e-Governance awardsIRCTC’s New Next Generation e-Ticketing System won the award for the most innovative use of internet technology by central government public sector units.

item.title: Govt to make public services available on mobiles
item.description: Govt to make public services available on mobilesThe move would be a vital element of India’s push to improve its ranking of 119 out of 193 countries in the UN E-Government Index.

item.title: Nearly 1,400 civilians killed in Russia's Syria air strikes: Reports
item.description: Moscow says it is targeting Islamic State militants but rebels and residents say the Russian air strikes are causing civilian casualties in bombing .

item.title: Polish parliament appoints two new rate-setters
item.description: PAP quoted the head of the chamber's chancellery, saying the new members will be sworn in on Feb. 10, they will not take part in meeting of MPC

item.title: Pakistan's central bank keeps main policy interest rate at 6 per cent
item.description: Pak's central bank kept its benchmark policy rate unchanged at 6% on Saturday, the State Bank of Pakistan governor Ashraf Mahmood Wathra said.

item.title: France's Fabius says Syria talks must ensure political transition
item.description: Peace talks being held in Geneva to try to end Syria's five-year-old war must ensure a political transition and human rights are respected:Laurent Fabius.

item.title: Iran to buy 40 ATR planes: vice minister
item.description: Iran expects to finalise within days a deal to buy up to 40 planes from ATR, the European manufacturer of turboprop aircraft, a deputy transport minister said today.

item.title: UN insists on global participation in Lanka rights probe
item.description: UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon has reiterated the need for international participation in accountability probes into alleged human rights abuses and war crimes.

item.title: Cambridge Technology Enterprises lines up Rs 8 crore to fund US-based startups
item.description: The investments aim to create a potential market for CTE’s solutions on big data analytics and cloud services.

item.title: Infosys promotes 2,100 employees after stellar Q3 numbers
item.description: The latest round of promotions have been handed out to executives and employees based on their performance as well as the maturity of their roles.

item.title: 3 Wipro staff arrested for breaching UK company TalkTalk's security
item.description: The criminal acts by the Wipro employees were discovered when TalkTalk conducted a forensic review of all its operations following the October cyberattack.

item.title: Google says G'day to Australian twang, slang
item.description: Google has added Australian slang and language recognition to its applications, addressing complaints that its software had difficulty in understanding thick local accents.

item.title: Microsoft's secret weapon for growth in the cloud: Satya Nadella
item.description: "Businesses everywhere are using the Microsoft Cloud as their digital platform to drive their ambitious transformation agendas," he said.

item.title: TalkTalk in talks with Wipro over security breach
item.description: Wipro said that the company is "working closely" with TalkTalk on this issue and will continue to extend full support to investigating authorities.

item.title: FM must rethink
item.description: TT Ram Mohan has rightly suggested that the tax-GDP ratio measures structural improvement. The FM must rethink his medium-term debtto-GDP target.

item.title: Amalgamate banks
item.description: Financial inclusion and financial literacy will be the paramount objective while implementing reforms along with UID project to protect the interests of poor.

item.title: Managing data
item.description: This refers to your edit ‘A welcome quest’ (ET, Oct 8). It is imperative to have a strong database.

item.title: Right technology
item.description: Apropos of ‘The climate conundrum’ (ET, Oct 9), Mukul Sanwal rightly suggests that developing countries should lead in setting the agenda for global technological cooperation.

item.title: Need to make India cost competitive, says DIPP secy
item.description: He further emphasized on manufacturing by saying that if India wants to grow consecutively then it can’t grow just with foreign direct investment.

item.title: ET GBS: Govt to exploit unviable coal mines to make urea: Gadkari
item.description: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said the government is importing urea from China which is making it through coal gasification.

item.title: Programmes not moving at required pace: L&T chief
item.description: India's largest infrastructure company feels that the government has the right intent but should also focus on implementing the plan on the ground.

item.title: ET GBS: Congress should see reason, help GST pass, says Arun Jaitley
item.description: Speaking at The ET Global Business Summit, Jaitley said the 3 objections raised by the Congress "go against the brain of what they themselves had brought".

item.title: India needs to be a low-cost hub for Make in India success: FM Arun Jaitley
item.description: The cost of wages in China, he said, is going up and so, India is back in competition. Lower commodity and oil prices are also acting as tailwinds.

item.title: India marching ahead on financial inclusion: Jayant Sinha
item.description: The RBI has issued 23 new banking licenses including those for payment banks bringing down the entry barriers significantly, said Sinha.

item.title: ET GBS: India in a sweet spot, but needs FDI right away, says Roubini
item.description: Professor Nouriel Roubini, at the ET Global Business Summit on Saturday, said the government was on right track but the slow speed of reforms is worrying.

item.title: D-Street divided on what RBI will do in Tuesday’s rate review
item.description: Rajan kept rates unchanged in the last meeting, citing concerns over US Fed rate hike while maintaining a very accommodative stance on further rate cuts.

item.title: PEs of 21 banks fall below 5-year average; is it time to look at them?
item.description: One of the reasons behind the sharp fall in bank stocks' prices is that earnings have failed to catch up as non-performing assets have surged.

item.title: Time to plug into power stocks? Much needed reforms big relief
item.description: The power sector has been reeling under the pressure of low power generation, muted growth of T&D and lack of regulations to tackle new issues cropping up.

item.title: Guest column: Indian market begins to decouple from international markets
item.description: Sometime during the middle of the week, the Chinese market fell by more than 6% and the US market lost 1.38%. But the Indian market stood resilient.

item.title: Despite headwinds, pharma stocks on a high; but handle them with care
item.description: With the rupee on a steady decline, investor focus has turned to the export-oriented businesses, and the pharma sector has hogged the limelight all through Jan.

item.title: Traders bet on calendar spread as Nifty moves in a tight range
item.description: A trading combination involving Nifty options is gaining prominence among savvy trading desks of institutional investors.

item.title: Nifty may find support at 5300 level
item.description: As far as stock futures are concerned, we are very near to the highest-ever open interest with 195 crore shares in open interest.

item.title: Seven out of top 10 Asian small-cap funds are Indian
item.description: An analysis of 300 Asian small-cap schemes shows DSP BlackRock Micro Cap Fund leading the charge, delivering an 82% return over the past year.

item.title: Inflation reflects growth dynamics in India: Christopher Wood
item.description: India has inflation and it reflects the fundamental growth, Christopher Wood, equity strategist, CLSA, said at ET Now Mkt Summit-2010.

item.title: Market may trade in a range, but FIIs seen sold on India
item.description: Market may see range-bound trading this week in the absence of any major trigger.

item.title: 'Don't bank only on price-to-earning ratio'
item.description: Many experts believe that looking at PE ratio in isolation won’t help investors grasp realities of the mkt and higher valuation may not be the only deciding factor driving mkt.

item.title: Every decision of government needn’t be a big reform: Anand Mahindra
item.description: "The fact that we are the world’s largest democracy and we are all aware that power and a role in global affairs for a nation comes from economic strength."

item.title: Narendra Modi has his eyes set on boosting business: Joao Cravinho, EU Ambassador
item.description: Ambassador Joao Cravinho, head of the EU delegation, led Ambassadors of various European countries to a quiet lunch with Modi at the capital last year.

item.title: Confidence level of industry improving: KV Kamath, ICICI Bank
item.description: "It is the collective wisdom of the marketplace that there is action and we will move with speed. That improves the confidence level of industry."

item.title: We may see rapid growth over the next few years: Raamdeo Agrawal
item.description: Directives from the Centre have to be executed at the state level. So, there are many things that are not in Modi’s hands, says Raamdeo Agrawal.

item.title: Our commitment for press freedom, and autonomy of public broadcast is absolute: Prakash Javadekar
item.description: "Now there is a stage three and stage four of digitisation, we will take a call on this only after taking all things into account."

item.title: There is a leadership vacuum in Infosys, time to get Nandan Nilekani back: Mohandas Pai
item.description: "There is a leadership vacuum in the company, because they made the wrong choice of CEO three years ago and that is playing out right now."

item.title: Alfa raises delisting price to Rs 2,850 a share
item.description: Alfa Laval (India) today said its parent firm has raised the delisting offer price to Rs 2,850 a share.

item.title: DB Realty, Unitech stocks rose
item.description: The stocks of DB Realty and Unitech rose after top executives of these companies were granted bail in the 2G scam case.

item.title: Fitch withdraws Reliance Capital ratings
item.description: Fitch on Friday said it has withdrawn the ratings on Reliance Capital as the company has decided to stop participating.

item.title: 'Discoms' poor fin health poses risks for traders'
item.description: The poor financial health of state electricity boards could pose significant business risks for power traders in the country, says Fitch.

item.title: Cigarette cos shares outperform benchmark Sensex
item.description: Shares of cigarette companies have rallied over the past one month, with ITC, Godfrey Philips and VST Industries hitting record highs.

item.title: Lovable Lingerie's dream run on as traders lap it up
item.description: Lovable Lingerie is 3rd-best performing stock among companies listed this year, with it doubling in value, as traders bet it could repeat performance of Page Indus.

item.title: After the Oscars, what's next for silent stars of The Artist?
item.description: The team behind The Artist will have spent the first day of the rest of their lives conforming to the grandest, and most lucrative, of Hollywood traditions.

item.title: Delhi World Book fair: A fair like no other
item.description: It's the World Book fair, which comes around once every two years sprawling across the giant halls of Pragati Maidan. This is the fair's 20th edition.

item.title: Indian gift makes its way to State Department exhibition
item.description: An elephant figurine gifted by the then HM LK Advani to US Secretary of State Colin Powell in 2002, has made its way to the State Department hall.

item.title: IMD to use dynamic models for forecasts
item.description: Statistical models used by IMD will still be used for monsoon forecast, but the ministry of earth sciences is putting more emphasis on dynamic models.

item.title: Docs reveal contents of first wire msg between India & Eng
item.description: Newly discovered documents have revealed the first telegraph messages and joy when England was linked for the first time with India on 23 June, 1870.

item.title: Worried Amitabh Bachchan fans pray to Lord Shiva for his recovery
item.description: Hundreds of worried fans of ailing Bollywood megastar Amitabh Bachchan today performed a yagna here to pray for his speedy recovery.

item.title: 'Big Daddy' laps up Cipla after Q1 nos beat forecast
item.description: Shares of Cipla inched up on heavy volumes on Friday, after the company’s first quarter earnings beat the consensus estimate.

item.title: Old Fox has dream run on Dalal Street
item.description: The Old Fox of Dalal Street has been on a dream run since the past couple of weeks. On Friday, most stocks that he had been steadily building up positions in figured among key gainers of the day.

item.title: Cairn India hits record high on BSE amid stake sale talks
item.description: The scrip, which was flat for most of the session, shot up in the final hour of trade on the Bombay Stock Exchange to settle with a net gain of 4.36 per cent at Rs 355.45.

item.title: Vedanta plunges 5.59% on LSE amid talks to buy Cairn stake
item.description: In the late afternoon session, the scrip was being traded at 20.61 pounds, down by 5.50 per cent on the LSE. Vedanta opened on a positive note, but soon swung into the red.

item.title: SBI shares on gaining spree; hit record high
item.description: In the past two days, the scrip recorded a gain of over 9 per cent on the BSE, making its investors richer by a whopping Rs 15,000 crore.

item.title: Water conservation mission in Rajasthan kicks off
item.description: The 'Mukhyamantri Jal Swavalamban Abhiyan' launched recently by C M Vasundhara Raje, has now garnered support from various sections of society.

item.title: AP failed to prevent industries from incurring losses: CPI(M)
item.description: P Madhu said the state government led by N Chandrababu Naidu failed to prevent existing industries from incurring losses.

item.title: Days of AIADMK rule in Tamil Nadu numbered: Kanimozhi
item.description: Kanimozhi said the people gathered in large numbers was a clear indiction that they wanted to install a DMK government in the state in the coming assembly polls.

item.title: Nitin Gadkari and Birender Singh slam Rahul over his protest in Hyderabad
item.description: Gadkari asked Gandhi to take up "whatever" issues he wants during upcoming session of Parliament instead of turning the HCU into a "political hub".

item.title: BJP workers join strike by sanitation workers
item.description: Yesterday, a group of workers and municipal corporation employees staged a protest outside Transport Minister Gopal Rai's office in Babarpur in east Delhi.

item.title: Bihar student receives call from Pakistan to join ISI
item.description: Mukesh Kumar filed a written complaint with Bhabua police station of Kaimur district about receiving a call from Pakistan over his mobile phone.

item.title: ET Search
item.description: Rupee#CAD#Economic crisis#Food Bill

item.title: Engineering’s India stake gets subscribed by 2.54 times
item.description: The stake sale received bids for over 3.39 crore shares, representing 1.01 times the total shares on offer as on 1300 hours, NSE data showed.

item.title: Precision Camshafts' IPO subscribed 1.89 times
item.description: The company has raised about Rs 410 crore, with a fresh share issue worth Rs 240 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of equity shares worth Rs 170 crore.

item.title: Vedanta Q3 net profit tanks 98.9 per cent, market cheers unexpected profit
item.description: Vedanta's total expenses fell 12 per cent to Rs 13,541.18 crore, from Rs 15,400.27 crore during the reported quarter.

item.title: Justdial shares tank 8.5 per cent as Q3 net profit shrinks
item.description: In terms of volume, 4.29 lakh shares of the company changed hands at BSE and over 26 lakh shares were traded at NSE during the day.

item.title: Government fixes Rs 189/share as floor price to sell Engineers India Ltd 's 10% stake
item.description: The floor price fixed for sale of 3.36 crore shares through an offer of sale, is at a discount of 2.4 per cent to the closing price of Rs 194.05 on BSE.

item.title: Bonds recover on good demand; call rates down
item.description: The 7.72 per cent government security maturing in 2025 firmed up to Rs 99.54 as against to Rs 99.4275, while its yield fell to 7.79 per cent from 7.81 per cent.

item.title: Prabhudas Lilladher has a reduce rating on Infosys
item.description: Prabhudas Lilladher has a ‘reduce’ rating on Infosys Technologies as it feels that the outlook for the company and the software industry is quite weak in the near-term.

item.title: Fin Crisis: Too late and too little done in US
item.description: A crisis of $240 trillion cannot be stemmed with bailout packages of $1 to $10 trillion. 2008: Year of global financial crisis | Survive credit crisis | Ghosts of 1929

item.title: Weak rupee takes its toll on cos with huge foreign debt
item.description: The falling rupee will severely affect the small companies, whereas the big ones will be impacted moderately. Get rid of Debt | Adopt correct investment strategies

item.title: Wait for more signals before turning positive
item.description: At the recent low of 12514 points, the Sensex has tested the 12800-12000-pts support zone and has since then attempted a corrective rally.

item.title: Six Indian cos among BusinessWeek's top 100 Infotech firms
item.description: BusinessWeek's 'The Infotech 100', has ranked Bharti Airtel at the 21st position followed by Reddington India (55th) and RCom (66th). Successful business formula

item.title: Indian firms slip in global ranking; four move out of Top-500
item.description: 14 firms present in a new list of world's 500 most valued firms together seeing an erosion of about $150 billion in their market value in the first three months of this year.
